ai.question: What is the purpose of an activation function in a neural network?
options: To introduce non-linearity into the network
ai.answer: To introduce non-linearity into the network

ai.question: Which algorithm is commonly used for anomaly detection in time-series data?
What does the term 'overfitting' refer to in machine learning?
options: The model performs well on the training data but poorly on unseen data.
The model fails to converge during training.
The model generalizes well to unseen data.
The model suffers from high bias.
ai.answer: The model performs well on the training data but poorly on unseen data.

ai.question: Which evaluation metric is commonly used for classification tasks and represents the ratio of correctly predicted instances to the total instances?
What is the purpose of dropout regularization in neural networks?
options: To reduce the computational cost of training the model
To prevent overfitting by randomly dropping units from the neural network during training
To speed up the convergence of the optimization algorithm
To increase the model's capacity to capture complex patterns in the data
ai.answer: To prevent overfitting by randomly dropping units from the neural network during training

ai.question: Which technique is used to transform categorical variables into numerical representations suitable for machine learning algorithms?
What is the purpose of the EM (Expectation-Maximization) algorithm in clustering?
options: To maximize the likelihood function of the data given the model parameters
To minimize the within-cluster sum of squares
To initialize the centroids for K-means clustering
To estimate the parameters of a mixture model from incomplete data
ai.answer: To estimate the parameters of a mixture model from incomplete data

ai.question: Which algorithm is commonly used for collaborative filtering in recommendation systems?

options: To evaluate the performance of machine learning models
To compare the effectiveness of different marketing strategies
To preprocess the data before model training
To visualize the distribution of data
ai.answer: To compare the effectiveness of different marketing strategies

The model generalizes well to unseen data.

ds.question: What is the primary difference between L1 and L2 regularization?
options: L1 regularization adds the absolute values of the coefficients to the loss function, while L2 regularization adds the squared values.
L1 regularization penalizes large coefficients more heavily than L2 regularization.
L2 regularization encourages sparsity in the coefficient values, while L1 regularization does not.
L2 regularization is only applicable to linear models, while L1 regularization can be used with any model.
ds.answer: L1 regularization adds the absolute values of the coefficients to the loss function, while L2 regularization adds the squared values.

ds.question: What is the purpose of the A/B test in data science?
options: To evaluate the performance of machine learning models
To compare the effectiveness of different marketing strategies
To preprocess the data before model training
To visualize the distribution of data
ds.answer: To compare the effectiveness of different marketing strategies

app_dev.question: What is the purpose of an Intent in Android development?
options: To handle background tasks in an Android app
To define the user interface layout of an Android app
To pass data between components within an Android app or between different apps
To manage the database operations in an Android app
app_dev.answer: To pass data between components within an Android app or between different apps

app_dev.question: Which of the following components is NOT part of the Android Architecture Components?
What is the purpose of the 'manifest' file in Android development?
options: To define the layout of user interface components
To manage the resources used by the app
To declare the app's components and their respective configurations
To define the database schema for the app
app_dev.answer: To declare the app's components and their respective configurations

To store and manage UI-related data in a lifecycle-conscious way
app_dev.answer: To store and manage UI-related data in a lifecycle-conscious way

To manage the app's user interface layout

To handle background tasks in an Android app
app_dev.answer: To store and retrieve small amounts of primitive data as key-value pairs

app_dev.question: What is the purpose of the 'RecyclerView' in Android development?

app_dev.answer: To efficiently display large datasets of scrollable lists

To pass data between components within an Android app or between different apps
app_dev.answer: To pass data between components within an Android app or between different apps

To provide pre-designed and reusable CSS styles for building websites
